title: [BUG] Fail to serve models stored in Azure Blob Storage

labels.name: needs author feedback
labels.description: Issue is waiting for the author to respond

body:
Thank you for submitting an issue. Please refer to our [issue policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md) for additional information about bug reports. For help with debugging your code, please refer to [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/mlflow).

**Please fill in this bug report template to ensure a timely and thorough response.**

### Willingness to contribute
The MLflow Community encourages bug fix contributions. Would you or another member of your organization be willing to contribute a fix for this bug to the MLflow code base?

- [ ] Yes. I can contribute a fix for this bug independently.
- [x] Yes. I would be willing to contribute a fix for this bug with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [ ] No. I cannot contribute a bug fix at this time.

### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**:
- **MacOS**
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**:
- **mlflow, version 1.8.0**:
- **Python 3.8.2**:
- **export AZURE_STORAGE_ACCESS_KEY=access-key && mlflow models serve -m wasbs://x-container@y-storage.blob.core.windows.net/mlflow/8/b76bc49b0e42424c8bc3f4341dbdbdfc/artifacts/model -p 5001**:

### Describe the problem
Unable to serve model stored in Azure blob storage. I can see model files (model.pk, MLmode & conda.yaml) located at the path specified as command param `mlflow models serve -m wasbs://x-container@storage.blob.core.windows.net/mlflow/8/b76bc49b0e42424c8bc3f4341dbdbdfc/artifacts/model -p 5001`
If I download model.pk, MLmode & conda.yaml files locally and run the command like this: `mlflow models serve -m . -p 5001`, it works. 

### Code to reproduce issue
1. Use Azure as a remote store to keep models
2. Run an experiment and log model
3. Use the run ID to serve model

### Other info / logs

> Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/waqassiddiqi/opt/anaconda3/envs/c-mlpipeline-dev/bin/mlflow", line 8, in <module>
    sys.exit(cli())
  File "/Users/waqassiddiqi/opt/anaconda3/envs/c-mlpipeline-dev/lib/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 829, in __call__
    return self.main(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/Users/waqassiddiqi/opt/anaconda3/envs/c-mlpipeline-dev/lib/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 782, in main
    rv = self.invoke(ctx)
  File "/Users/waqassiddiqi/opt/anaconda3/envs/c-mlpipeline-dev/lib/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1259, in invoke
    return _process_result(sub_ctx.command.invoke(sub_ctx))
  File "/Users/waqassiddiqi/opt/anaconda3/envs/c-mlpipeline-dev/lib/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1259, in invoke
    return _process_result(sub_ctx.command.invoke(sub_ctx))
  File "/Users/waqassiddiqi/opt/anaconda3/envs/c-mlpipeline-dev/lib/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1066, in invoke
    return ctx.invoke(self.callback, **ctx.params)
  File "/Users/waqassiddiqi/opt/anaconda3/envs/c-mlpipeline-dev/lib/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 610, in invoke
    return callback(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/Users/waqassiddiqi/opt/anaconda3/envs/c-mlpipeline-dev/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/models/cli.py", line 53, in serve
    return _get_flavor_backend(model_uri,
  File "/Users/waqassiddiqi/opt/anaconda3/envs/c-mlpipeline-dev/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/models/cli.py", line 164, in _get_flavor_backend
    model = Model.load(local_path)
  File "/Users/waqassiddiqi/opt/anaconda3/envs/c-mlpipeline-dev/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/models/__init__.py", line 73, in load
    with open(path) as f:
FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/var/folders/dt/9f6c710j2sq7pybth858lzzw0000gn/T/tmpvm1zvbhq/MLmodel/MLmodel'
make: *** [serve] Error 1


### What component(s), interfaces, languages, and integrations does this bug affect?
Components 
- [x] `area/artifacts`: Artifact stores and artifact logging
- [ ] `area/build`: Build and test infrastructure for MLflow
- [ ] `area/docs`: MLflow documentation pages
- [ ] `area/examples`: Example code
- [ ] `area/model-registry`: Model Registry service, APIs, and the fluent client calls for
Model Registry
- [x] `area/models`: MLmodel format, model serialization/deserialization, flavors
- [ ] `area/projects`: MLproject format, project running backends
- [ ] `area/scoring`: Local serving, model deployment tools, spark UDFs
- [ ] `area/tracking`: Tracking Service, tracking client APIs, autologging
